page.title: 06Schools in Willenhall area.
page.content:
The secondary schools are all fairly new buildings,all of them classed as community schools with their facilities open to local residents. Several of the primary schools,however are housed in very old buildings,some over 100 years old.The main problem is falling rolls,some classes containing little more than 20 pupils.The yearly roll at Elmore Green J.M.I.shows this:
1975-6 368 1980-1 259 1976-7 346 1981-2 229 1977-8 339 1982-3 204 1978-9 336 1983-4 189 1979-80 299 1984-5 183
It is therefore possible that some schools in the area will have to close.
